## Decree-by-Law No. 62 of 2025
Amending Certain Provisions of the Code of Criminal Procedure and Trials
Promulgated by Law No. 17 of 1960

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And the Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 H, corresponding to 10 May 2024 M,
- And the Penal Code promulgated by Law No. 16 of 1960, and its amending laws,
- And the Code of Criminal Procedure and Trials promulgated by Law No. 17 of 1960, and its amending laws,
- And the Social Security Law promulgated by Law No. 61 of 1976, and its amending laws,
- And the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure promulgated by Decree-by-Law No. 38 of 1980, and its amending laws,
- And the Law on the Organization of the Judiciary promulgated by Decree-by-Law No. 23 of 1990, and its amending laws,
- And the Law on Supporting and Encouraging National Labor to Work in Non-Governmental Sectors, as amended by Law No. 32 of 2003,
- And Law No. 2 of 2014 regarding Electronic Transactions,
- And Decree No. 84 of 2024 regarding Ministerial Substitutions and Delegations, and its amending decrees,
- And upon the proposal of the Minister of Justice <orig>وزير العدل</orig>,
- And with the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,
- We have issued the following Decree-by-Law:

### Article One

The texts of Articles (188) and (230) of the aforementioned Code of Criminal Procedure and Trials shall be replaced by the following texts:

### Article (188)

The period for opposition is one week. For misdemeanors, it begins from the date the judgment in absentia is served on the convicted person. For felonies, it begins from the date of the convicted person's arrest if the judgment has not been served on them in person. If this period expires without the convicted person filing an opposition, the judgment may only be challenged by appeal, if it is appealable.

The judgment in absentia shall be served to the person of the convicted party, or by email, or by any other modern means of communication that can be saved and retrieved, in accordance with the terms and conditions stipulated in the aforementioned Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure.

If it is not possible to serve the judgment to the convicted party, the notice shall be delivered to their place of residence to any of their relatives or in-laws residing with them, or to any of their dependents. If none of them are found, or if the person found refuses to accept the notice, the notice shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> and posted in prominent places in the area, and in a prominent place at their residence or workplace, and in any other place where its publication is deemed appropriate.

### Article (230)

If the convicted party fails to pay the fine imposed, it shall be collected by means of compulsory execution against their assets. The Public Prosecution <orig>النيابة العامة</orig> may collect it through monthly deductions not exceeding one-quarter of the amount the convicted party receives as a salary, wage, employment support, or pension.

The president of the court that issued the judgment, or the Public Prosecutor <orig>النائب العام</orig> or their delegate, upon the request of the convicted party, may order the payment of the imposed fine in installments or its postponement for a reasonable period, provided that justification is submitted, on the condition that the full payment of the imposed fine is not delayed for more than five years.

### Article Two

The ministers – each within their own jurisdiction – shall implement this Decree-Law. It shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> and shall come into force from the date of its publication.

Amir of Kuwait

While law in general is of paramount importance in preserving rights and regulating relationships between individuals, the Code of Criminal Procedure <orig>قانون الإجراءات الجزائية</orig> acquires a special significance, as it addresses the mechanism for applying these laws in practice, and clarifies the method of administering justice through legal tools that ensure every individual can access their rights with ease and facility.
Perhaps one of the greatest roles undertaken by the Code of Criminal Procedure and Trials <orig>قانون الإجراءات والمحاكمات الجزائية</orig> is its affirmation of state sovereignty. A state cannot be considered truly sovereign unless it has the ability to enforce its laws, execute its judgments, and set the foundations of justice in motion to reach every rights-holder at all times and in all places.
Hence, it can be said that the Code of Criminal Procedure and Trials <orig>قانون الإجراءات والمحاكمات الجزائية</orig> is the state's tool for imposing its sovereignty throughout its territory, and it is the guarantor of embodying the idea of true justice, which is not limited to the texts of the law but is reflected in the actual implementation of those texts.
However, the practical application of laws is not without its challenges. Practical experience has shown the need to keep pace with developments in communication methods, especially in light of the success of implementing "electronic notification" <orig>الإعلان الإلكتروني</orig> for serving statements of claim and appeals in accordance with the provisions of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات المدنية والتجارية</orig> issued by Decree-Law No. 38 of 1980. Furthermore, there are numerous problems related to the collection of criminally imposed fines, problems that have become a significant obstacle to achieving social and financial justice.
Whereas the Amiri Order <orig>الأمر الأميري</orig> was issued on 10/5/2024, and Article (4) thereof stipulated that laws shall be issued by decree-laws, therefore, the corresponding draft decree-law was prepared, and its first article provided for the replacement of Articles (188 and 230) of the Code of Criminal Procedure and Trials <orig>قانون الإجراءات والمحاكمات الجزائية</orig> issued by Law No. 17 of 1960. The amended Article (188) stipulated that a judgment in absentia shall be served to the person of the convicted party, or by electronic mail, or by any other modern means of communication that can be saved and retrieved, in accordance with the rules set out in the aforementioned Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات المدنية والتجارية</orig>.
The amended Article (230) included provisions to address the problem revealed by practical experience regarding the extensive accumulation of criminally imposed fines, such that these amounts have become a heavy burden that is difficult to collect in many cases. To make matters worse, the failure to collect these fines from the convicted has resulted in a series of serious legal problems, most notably the statute of limitations on criminal cases and the lapsing of penalties due to the passage of time. These issues ultimately lead to the state losing its legitimate right to collect these amounts, even though these fines are a right with a general privilege that the Public Treasury <orig>الخزانة العامة</orig> must collect for the benefit of the nation.
For this reason, the amended text was introduced to define more effective procedures for collecting criminal fines. It stipulates that if the convicted person does not pay the imposed fine, it shall be collected by means of compulsory execution against their assets. It also permits the Public Prosecution <orig>النيابة العامة</orig> to collect it through monthly deductions not exceeding one-quarter of the convicted person's salary, wage, employment support, or pension. This text also grants the authority to the president of the court that issued the judgment, or to the Public Prosecutor <orig>النائب العام</orig> or their delegate, to order the payment of the adjudicated amount in installments or to postpone it for a reasonable period upon the request of the convicted person, provided they submit justification for it, on the condition that the full payment of the adjudicated amount is not delayed beyond five years.
This ensures that such amounts do not accumulate, on the one hand, and prevents the loss of the state's rights, on the other.
<page_end>3</page_end>

# Decree No. 64 of 2025
## Approving the Agreement between the Government of the State of Kuwait and the Federal Government of Austria on Visa Exemption for Holders of Diplomatic and Special Passports of the State of Kuwait and Holders of Diplomatic and Service Passports of the Republic of Austria

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And the Amiri Order <orig>الأمر الأميري</orig> issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 H, corresponding to 10 May 2024 G,
- And Decree No. 84 of 2024 concerning Ministerial Substitutions and Delegations, and its amending decrees,
- And upon the proposal of the Minister of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزير الخارجية</orig>,
- And with the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,

**We decree the following**

### Article One
The Agreement between the Government of the State of Kuwait <orig>حكومة دولة الكويت</orig> and the Federal Government of Austria <orig>الحكومة الاتحادية النمساوية</orig> on Visa Exemption for Holders of Diplomatic and Special Passports of the State of Kuwait and Holders of Diplomatic and Service Passports of the Republic of Austria, signed in New York City on 26/9/2024, the text of which is attached to this Decree, is hereby approved.

### Article Two
The Ministers – each within their respective jurisdiction – shall implement this Decree, and it shall come into force from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

**Amir of Kuwait**
**Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>**

**Acting Prime Minister**
**Fahad Yousef Saud Al-Sabah <orig>فهد يوسف سعود الصباح</orig>**

**Minister of Foreign Affairs**
**Abdullah Ali Abdullah Al-Yahya <orig>عبد الله علي عبد الله اليحيا</orig>**

Issued at Seif Palace on: 15 Shawwal 1446 H
Corresponding to: 13 April 2025 G

## Agreement between the Government of the State of Kuwait and the Federal Government of Austria on Visa Exemption for Holders of Diplomatic and Special Passports of the State of Kuwait and Holders of Diplomatic and Service Passports of the Republic of Austria

The Government of the State of Kuwait <orig>حكومة دولة الكويت</orig> and the Federal Government of Austria <orig>الحكومة الاتحادية النمساوية</orig> (hereinafter referred to as "the Parties"),
Desiring to facilitate the entry of holders of diplomatic and special passports of the State of Kuwait, and holders of diplomatic and service passports of the Republic of Austria,
Have agreed as follows:

### Article 1
(1) Citizens of the State of Kuwait, who hold a valid biometric diplomatic or special passport, shall not be required to obtain a visa to enter the territory of the Republic of Austria, and may stay for a period not exceeding 90 (ninety) days within any 180 (one hundred and eighty) day period, calculated from the day of first entry, either into the territory of the Republic of Austria or the territory of any other state to which the Schengen Agreement of 19 June 1990 implementing the Schengen Agreement of 14 June 1985 on the gradual abolition of checks at their common borders is applicable.
(2) Citizens of the Republic of Austria, who hold a valid biometric diplomatic or service passport, shall not be required to obtain a visa to enter the territory of the State of Kuwait, and may stay for a period not exceeding 90 (ninety) days within any 180 (one hundred and eighty) day period from the date of entry.

### Article 2
Holders of a valid biometric diplomatic or service passport of the Republic of Austria and holders of a valid biometric diplomatic or special passport of the State of Kuwait may enter and exit the territory of the other Party at any point authorized for this purpose by the competent immigration authorities, without any restrictions except for those stipulated in the provisions of security, immigration, customs, health entry, and other provisions that may legally apply to holders of valid passports.

### Article 3
The provisions of Article 1 of this Agreement shall not apply to persons who plan to stay in the territory of the other Party for a period longer than that stipulated in Article 1, or who intend to obtain employment there.

### Article 4
Citizens of either Party who enjoy privileges and immunities in accordance with international law and who hold their own identity card issued by the host state shall not require a visa or residence permit to stay in or return to the territory of that Party, as long as this identity card is valid and is presented upon entry with a valid biometric diplomatic or service passport of the Republic of Austria or a valid biometric diplomatic or special passport of the State of Kuwait.

## Article 5
(1) The Parties shall exchange, through diplomatic channels, specimens of the passports in accordance with Article 1 of this Agreement used by either Party within 30 (thirty) days after the signing of this Agreement. Each Party shall provide the other Party with a specimen of any new or amended diplomatic, service, or special passport at least 30 (thirty) days prior to the issuance of such passports.
(2) Both Parties shall duly inform each other of any amendments made to their respective national laws and regulations concerning the issuance of passports.
(3) If a national of either Party loses their valid passport referred to in Article 1 of this Agreement in the territory of the other Party, they must inform the competent authorities of the host state. The diplomatic or consular mission shall issue a new passport or travel document to the said national and inform the competent authorities of the host state.

## Article 6
(1) This Agreement shall not exempt the nationals of either Party from the obligation to respect the laws and regulations of the other Party concerning the entry, stay, and exit of foreigners.
(2) Both Parties reserve the right to refuse entry or shorten the duration of stay of persons who are considered undesirable or who endanger public peace, order, health, or national security.

## Article 7
Either Party may temporarily suspend this Agreement for reasons of public order, protection of national security, public health, or due to illegal immigration, conflict of interest in the field of human rights and fundamental freedoms, or lack of cooperation in the field of readmission. The other Party shall be immediately notified of the commencement of the suspension as well as its cancellation, through diplomatic channels.

## Article 8
Any dispute that may arise from the application and/or interpretation of this Agreement shall be settled through diplomatic channels and through consultations or negotiations.

## Article 9
This Agreement may be amended by mutual written consent of both Parties at any time. The amendments shall enter into force in accordance with the procedures stipulated in Article 10 (1) of this Agreement.

## Article (10)
(1) This Agreement shall enter into force on the date of receipt of the last written notification through diplomatic channels, by which the Parties notify each other of the completion of their respective constitutional procedures for its entry into force.
(2) This Agreement shall remain in force for a period of five years from the date of its entry into force and shall be automatically renewed for a similar period or periods, unless one Party notifies the other Party in writing and through diplomatic channels of its intention to terminate this Agreement 6 months prior to its expiration date.
(3) The termination of this Agreement shall not affect the validity or duration of any specific agreements, projects, and activities undertaken under this Agreement.
Done in New York City on September 26, 2024, in two original copies in the Arabic, German, and English languages, all texts being equally authentic. In case of divergence in interpretation, the English text shall prevail.

For

(2)Austrian nationals, who are holders of a valid biometric diplomatic, or service passport, shall not be required to obtain a visa to enter the territory of the State of Kuwait for a period which does not exceed 90 (ninety) days within a 180 (one hundred and eighty)-day period counted from the date of entry.

## Article 2
Holders of a valid biometric diplomatic or service passport of the Republic of Austria and holders of a valid biometric diplomatic or special passport of the State of Kuwait may enter into and depart from the territory of the other Party at any point authorised for that purpose by the competent immigration authorities, without any restriction except for those stipulated in the security, migratory, customs, sanitary entry and other provisions which may be legally applicable to holders of such valid passports.

## Article 3
The provisions of Article 1 of this Agreement do not apply to persons, who are planning to stay in the territory of the other Party for a period longer than the one stated in Article 1, or intending to take up employment there.

## Article 4
Nationals of either Party enjoying privileges and immunities according to international law and who are holders of the respective ID card issued by the receiving country, do not need a visa or a residence permit to stay in or to re-enter the territory of this Party as long as this ID card is valid and presented upon entry along with a valid biometric diplomatic or service passport of the Republic of Austria or a valid biometric diplomatic or special passport of the State of Kuwait.

## Article 5
(1)The Parties shall exchange, through diplomatic channels, samples of the passports according to Article 1 of this agreement used by either Party within 30 (thirty) days after the signing of this Agreement; and each Party shall provide to the other Party the sample of any new or changed diplomatic, service or special passport within at least 30 (thirty) days before issuing such passports.
(2)Both Parties shal' duly inform each other about any modification introduced in their respective national laws and regulations related to passport issuance.
(3)If a national of either Party loses his/her valid passport referred to in Article 1 of this Agreement in the territory of the other Party, he/she shall inform the competent authorities of the receiving Party. The diplomatic mission or consulate concerned shall issue a new passport or travel document to the aforementioned national and inform the competent authorities of the receiving Party.

## Article 6
(1)This Agreement does not exempt citizens of either Party from the obligation to respect the laws and regulations of the other Party concerning the entry, stay and exit of foreigners.
(2)Both Parties reserve the right to refuse admission to or shorten the stay of persons considered undesirable or endangering public peace, order, health or national security.

## Article 7
Either Party may suspend this Agreement, for reasons of public order, national security, public health, irregular immigration, conflicts of interests in the area of human rights and fundamental freedoms or lack of cooperation in the area of readmission. The suspension as well as its termination shall be notified immediately to the other Party through diplomatic channels.

## Article 8
Any dispute that may arise from the application and/or interpretation of this Agreement shall be settled through diplomatic channels and through consultations or negotiations.

## Article 9
This Agreement may be amended by the mutual written consent of both Parties at any time. The amendments shall enter into force in accordance with the procedures prescribed in Article 10 (1) of this Agreement.

## Article 10
(1) This Agreement shall enter into force on the date of the receipt of the last written notification through diplomatic channels by which the Parties notify each other of the completion of their constitutional procedures for its entry into force.
(2) This Agreement shall remain in force for a period of 5 years from the date of its entry into force and shall be renewed automatically for similar period or periods, unless one of the Parties notifies the other in writing and through diplomatic channels about its intention to terminate it 6 months before its expiration date.
(3) The termination of the Agreement shall not affect the validity or the duration of any specific agreements, projects and activities made under this Agreement.
DONE in New York City on 26 September 2024, in two originals, each in English, Arabic and German language, all texts being equally authentic. In case of discrepancies in interpretation of the provisions of the present agreement, the English text shall prevail.

<header>

Sunday, 22 Shawwal 1446 H - 20/4/2025 AD
12

**It is decided**

### Article One
The following terms, wherever they appear in this Decision, shall have the meanings indicated next to each:

<table_caption>Definitions of Terms Used in this Decision</table_caption>
<table>
| | |
|:---|:---|
| Service Provider: | An internet service provider licensed by the Communication and Information Technology Regulatory Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاتصالات وتقنية المعلومات</orig> to provide internet services. |
| Existing Capacities: | The total capacity subscriptions registered for each service provider at the time of issuance of this Decision. |
| Additional Capacities: | The capacities allocated to the service provider in addition to the existing capacities, at a rate of (1 Gbps) for each capacity allocated in accordance with the provisions of this Decision. |
</table>

### Article Two
The provisions of this Decision shall apply only to additional capacity subscriptions allocated to service providers from the effective date of this Decision. The tariff stipulated in the aforementioned Ministerial Decision No. (347) of 2016 shall continue to apply to existing capacity subscriptions.

### Article Three
Without prejudice to the tariff stipulated in Article One of the aforementioned Decision No. (347) of 2016, the value for the allocation of additional capacity subscriptions for a capacity of (1 Gbps) shall be (12,000) (twelve thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) K.D. annually.

### Article Four
The allocation period for the additional capacity mentioned in Article Three of this Decision shall be one full calendar year, and the fee for its allocation shall be paid in advance to the Ministry of Communications <orig>وزارة المواصلات</orig>, in addition to installation fees. The allocation value is non-refundable.

### Article Five
For the tariff mentioned in Article Three of this Decision to apply, the service provider must continue to renew and not reduce the existing capacity subscriptions for each system separately (NGN-B / NGN-A).

### Article Six
Should the service provider reduce its existing capacities during the period of benefiting from the allocation according to the value mentioned in Article Three of this Decision, the following consequences shall apply:
1. The provision of Article Three of this Decision shall no longer apply to the service provider.
2. The value stipulated in the aforementioned Ministerial Decision No. (347) of 2016 shall apply to all capacities.
The date of the reduction in existing capacities shall be the date relied upon when conducting the financial settlement.

### Article Seven
The provisions of the aforementioned Ministerial Decision No. (347) of 2016 shall apply to matters not specifically regulated by this Decision.

### Article Eight
This Decision shall be published in the Official Gazette, and shall be effective from the date of its publication for a period of one year.

Minister of State for Communications Affairs
Omar Saud Abdulaziz Al-Omar <orig>عمر سعود عبد العزيز العمر</orig>

Issued on: 14 April 2025 AD

## Decision No. (60) of 2025 Regarding the Licensing Application Submitted by Rasameel Investment Company to Practice Securities Activities

### Having perused:
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities, its executive regulations, and their amendments;

### Has decided the following:
### Article One
The Authority grants initial approval to Rasameel Investment Company <orig>شركة رساميل للاستثمار</orig> to be licensed for the activity of a securities broker not registered with the securities exchange.
This approval is valid for a renewable period of six months, starting from 16/04/2025 and ending on 15/10/2025, to fulfill the criteria set by the Authority.

### Article Two
The company mentioned in this decision shall be licensed after completing the requirements indicated in the initial approval letter issued by the Authority, for a renewable period of three years from the date of issuance of the Authority's license certificate and after payment of the prescribed fee.

### Article Three
The competent authorities shall implement this decision, each within its own jurisdiction. It shall take effect from the date of its issuance and shall be published in the Official Gazette.

# Kuwait Direct Investment Promotion Authority <orig>هيئة تشجيع الاستثمار المباشر</orig>
## Ministerial Decision No. (157) of 2025 Regarding the Lifting of the Deprivation of the Tax Exemption Benefit
The Minister of Finance and Minister of State for Economic Affairs and Investment <orig>وزير المالية ووزير الدولة للشؤون الاقتصادية والاستثمار</orig>:
- Having reviewed Law No. (116) of 2013 regarding the promotion of direct investment in the State of Kuwait,
- And the Decision of the Minister of Commerce and Industry No. (502) of 2014 issuing the Executive Regulations for Law No. (116) of 2013 regarding the promotion of direct investment in the State of Kuwait,
- And the Decision of the Director General <orig>مدير عام</orig> of the Kuwait Direct Investment Promotion Authority <orig>هيئة تشجيع الاستثمار المباشر</orig> No. (329) of 2019 regarding the point calculation mechanism for evaluating investment license applications and granting benefits,
- And the Decision of the Director General <orig>مدير عام</orig> of the Kuwait Direct Investment Promotion Authority <orig>هيئة تشجيع الاستثمار المباشر</orig> No. (75) of 2022 imposing an administrative penalty,
- And the report of the Follow-up and Audit Department, which includes the correction of the violation and the investment entity's compliance with the licensing requirements and the provisions of the aforementioned Law No. (116) of 2013,
- And the decision of the Board of Directors of the Kuwait Direct Investment Promotion Authority <orig>هيئة تشجيع الاستثمار المباشر</orig> in its meeting No. (1/2025) held on 23/2/2025,
- And based on the presentation by the Director General <orig>مدير عام</orig> of the Kuwait Direct Investment Promotion Authority <orig>هيئة تشجيع الاستثمار المباشر</orig>,
- And in the public interest.

### Has Decided
#### Article One
The deprivation of the tax exemption benefit <orig>ميزة الإعفاء الضريبي</orig> for the investment entity below is lifted after the correction of the violation, in accordance with Clause Two of Article (32) of the aforementioned Law No. (116) of 2013, as follows:

<table_caption>Details of Lifting Tax Exemption Deprivation</table_caption>
<table>
| Investment Entity | Investment License | Commercial License | Violation Corrected | Date Deprivation Lifted |
|:---|:---|:---|:---|:---|
| Land and Housing <orig>لاند أند هاوسينغ</orig> | M1 20/2017 | 1153/2017 | Violation of licensing requirements by not meeting the agreed-upon number of national employees | 18/9/2024 |
</table>

#### Article Two
This decision shall be published in the Official Gazette, and the concerned authorities shall implement it, each within its jurisdiction.

**Minister of Finance and Minister of State for Economic Affairs and Investment**
**Chairman of the Board of Directors of the Kuwait Direct Investment Promotion Authority**
**Eng. Noura Sulaiman Salem Al-Fassam <orig>م. نورة سليمان سالم الفصام</orig>**

# Ministry of Commerce and Industry
## Correction
A material error occurred in the announcement by the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> regarding MS Tex International for Readymade Garments <orig>ام اس تكس إنترناشيونال للملابس الجاهزة</orig> ## Company Under Liquidation, in Issue 1734 published on Sunday, 13/4/2025, where an error was made in the company's name.
Therefore, we are republishing the announcement after correcting the error.
## Announcement
The owners of the company / MS Tex International for Readymade Garments <orig>ام اس تكس إنترناشيونال للملابس الجاهزة</orig> ## Company Under Liquidation have submitted a request to the Department of Partnerships at the Ministry to carry out the dissolution and liquidation of the company. Legal Entity: One-Person Company.
Anyone with an objection is requested to approach the Court of First Instance within thirty days from the date of this announcement's publication, in accordance with the usual procedures for filing a lawsuit. The submission of an objection will result in the continued liability of the joint partners (in the case of a general or simple limited partnership only) towards this creditor until their objection is decided by a final judgment.

# The Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig>
## Announcement
Regarding the launch of Auction No. (AD/134/2024-2025) for the license to utilize, manage, and operate an investment site for serving fresh juices (local) in Al Shaheed Park - Phase Three - Site No. (H2)

The Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> announces the launch of Auction No. (AD/134/2024-2025) for the license to utilize, manage, and operate an investment site for serving fresh juices (local) in Al Shaheed Park - Phase Three - Site No. (H2). Companies or institutions specialized in this field who wish to participate may obtain the booklet of conditions and auction documents during official working hours from (The Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> – Bayan Palace – Administrative Building – First Floor – Zone 7 – Tenders and Follow-up Department). This can be done during official working hours starting from the date of this announcement's publication in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) for a non-refundable fee of (75 K.D.) only seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig> (payment via K-Net only) for the booklet. Owners of small and medium enterprises are exempt from this fee (upon presentation of the relevant certificate). Documents will be available starting from Sunday, 20/4/2025, from 8:30 AM until 1:00 PM, taking into account the following:
1- The deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Thursday, 1/5/2025. No bids will be accepted after this deadline.
2- Bids must be submitted in a sealed envelope to the Tenders and Follow-up Department – at Bayan Palace – Administrative Building – First Floor – Zone 7.
3- A preliminary deposit of not less than (2%) of the bid value must be submitted in favor of the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> in the form of a letter of guarantee or a certified check from a Kuwaiti bank, valid for the entire duration of the bid's validity, which is (90) days.
4- A valid certificate of compliance with the national labor percentage must be submitted.
5- An authorization letter and a copy of the Civil ID of the company's representative for purchasing the auction document.
6- This auction is indivisible, and alternative offers are not permitted.
7- The bidder must submit a letter with an attached copy of the registration certificate from the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry.
8- The site inspection and preliminary meeting will be held on Sunday, 27/4/2025, at 10:00 AM in Al Shaheed Park - Phase Three.

1. Registration receipt with the Diwan of His Highness the Crown Prince <orig>ديوان سمو ولي العهد</orig> for the fiscal year 2025 - 2026, or a copy of the license from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.

7. A copy of a valid registration receipt from the Central Agency for Information Technology <orig>الجهاز المركزي لتكنولوجيا المعلومات</orig>.

9. A valid certificate from the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> regarding the national labor percentage.
10. An authorization letter from the company/institution for the person authorized to purchase the tender documents.

# Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig>
## Announcement

The Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig> announces Auction No. (2025/2026-01) for the utilization and management of the first, second, third, and fifth floors, with furniture, in the Kuwait Credit Bank building located in the Qibla area <orig>منطقة القبلة</orig>, in accordance with the terms and specifications contained in the auction documents, which can be obtained from the Bank's building in Surra – Finance Department – Sixth Floor.

Interested companies should visit the Bank during the following hours, from (8:00 AM to 1:00 PM), to receive the booklet of general conditions and specifications for a non-refundable fee of (75/- K.D.) seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, bringing with them the following documents:

1- A copy of a valid Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig>.
2- A copy of a valid certificate from the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>.
3- The bidder must have a valid license issued by the Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>.
4- The bidder must submit a detailed record of the works they have undertaken related to what is required, with authenticated certificates from the relevant authorities.
5- The bidder must have a qualified team with professional experience and full knowledge of the nature of the required work.
6- A letter of authorization from the company to purchase the auction documents, attaching the name of the authorized signatory or signatories for contracting with the Bank and their signature samples.
7- The bid must be accompanied by an initial deposit <orig>تأمين ابتدائي</orig> of 2,000 K.D. This deposit shall be in the form of a certified check <orig>شيك مصدق</orig> or a letter of guarantee <orig>خطاب ضمان</orig> from an approved bank in Kuwait in favor of the Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig>, unconditional and valid for the entire duration of the bid's validity.
8- The site visit will be at the Bank's building located in the Qibla area <orig>منطقة القبلة</orig> on Thursday, 08/05/2025, from 10:00 AM to 11:00 AM.
9- A preliminary meeting will be held at the Bank's main building in South Surra <orig>جنوب السرة</orig> – Fifth Floor, meeting room, on Sunday, 11/05/2025, from 10:00 AM to 11:00 AM.
10- Bids must be submitted in a sealed envelope addressed to the Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig> and deposited in the Bank's Auction Committee box at the Finance Department of the Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig> (South Surra) no later than 1:00 PM on Thursday, 15/05/2025.

# Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig>
Announcement

The Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> announces the issuance of Practice No.: M I/914 for the year: 2025-2026 regarding the supply, installation, inspection, delivery, warranty, training, and provision of emergency equipment and a system for monitoring satellite transmission for the Ministry of Information, in accordance with the technical terms and specifications contained in the practice documents, which can be purchased from the Ministry of Information's website via the barcode attached to this announcement, starting from Sunday, 20/4/2025, for a non-refundable fee of (50 K.D. /-) only fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>. Bids shall be submitted to the Procurement Department at the Ministry of Information in sealed envelopes, accompanied by a preliminary insurance of (2%) of the bid value (which must be valid for the entire duration of the bid's validity for a period of 90 days). The practice number, as indicated above, must be written on the outside of the envelope, avoiding any mention of the bidder's name or any identifying marks. The deadline for bid submission is 1:00 PM on Sunday, 18/5/2025.

- The Ministry of Information will hold a preliminary meeting on Tuesday, 6/5/2025, at 11:00 AM in the office of the Assistant Undersecretary for Engineering Affairs - Information Complex - Al-Soor Street - Ground Floor, to answer inquiries regarding the practice. Anyone who has purchased the practice documents may attend the meeting in person or be represented. Everything recorded in the minutes of the meeting shall be considered an integral part of the practice documents and shall be binding on all bidders. The Ministry will circulate the questions, inquiries, and their answers after approval to all bidders before the bid closing date.
- All documents must be submitted on three (3) non-copiable CDs, with the exception of (the bid form, the preliminary insurance, a copy of the purchase receipt, and the bidder's data form).
- The practice is indivisible, and alternative bids will not be accepted.
- This announcement serves as an invitation for bidders wishing to attend the envelope-opening session, following coordination with the Procurement Department before the day scheduled for the bid-opening session.
- A valid certificate of national labor percentage compliance, issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>, must be submitted with the bid. Please note that bids not including this certificate will be disqualified.
- The bidder must attach a valid "To Whom It May Concern" certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> stating that there are no holds on the bidder's file for government contracts registered with the Authority due to any of the violations mentioned in Article 10 of Law No. 6 of 2010 regarding labor in the private sector. Please note that bids not including this certificate will be disqualified.
- Owners of small and medium enterprises are exempt from the fees for purchasing the documents, in accordance with the provisions of Article 39 of Law No. 74/2019 regarding amendments to Law No. 49 of 2016.
- Owners of small and medium enterprises wishing to apply for the practice must attach to their bid a valid certificate issued by the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig>, confirming their accreditation as a small or medium enterprise.
- This announcement is considered an integral part of the practice documents.
- To obtain a copy, the bidder must register and pay the fees through the website https://eservice.media.gov.kw/purchase

## Ajal Holding Company <orig>شركة آجال القابضة</orig>
**(Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company)**
**Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting**

At 11:00 AM on Monday, 24/03/2025, the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting of Ajal Holding Company <orig>شركة آجال القابضة</orig> was held at the headquarters of Ajal for General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة آجال للمقاولات والتجارة العامة</orig>. The meeting was chaired by the Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors, Mr. Bishr Abdullah Al-Bishr <orig>السيد/ بشر عبدالله البشر</orig>, and attended by the Secretary of the Board of Directors, Mr. Abdulaziz Abdullah Al-Bishr <orig>السيد/ عبدالعزيز عبدالله البشر</orig>. The attendance quorum reached 100%, with 21,000,000 shares represented, comprising 20,212,504 shares in person and 787,496 shares by proxy.
The meeting was opened after the legal quorum for convening the General Assembly was met, and the discussion of the General Assembly's agenda began as follows:
First Item: To cancel the General Assembly's resolution issued on 12/06/2024 regarding the approval of the Board of Directors' proposal to increase the company's capital through in-kind contributions <orig>بحصص عينية</orig> in accordance with the asset valuation report prepared by BDO for Economic, Administrative, Industrial, and Computer Consulting and Opening Private Training Institutes (W.L.L.) <orig>شركة BDO للاستشارات الاقتصادية والإدارية والصناعية والكمبيوتر وفتح المعاهد التدريبية الأهلية (ذ.م.م)</orig>. The increase was to raise the company's authorized and issued capital from KWD 2,100,000 (only two million one hundred thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) divided into 21,000,000 shares with a par value of one hundred (100) fils per share, to KWD 20,786,726 (only twenty million seven hundred eighty-six thousand seven hundred twenty-six Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) divided into 207,867,260 shares with a par value of one hundred (100) fils per share, as this increase has not been recorded in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> to date.
Unanimously approved.

The shareholders present at the meeting agreed that Mr. Anwar Talal Al-Fadhli <orig>أنور طلال الفضلي</orig> – Deputy Chairman of the Board of Directors – would chair the meeting session.
The meeting was also attended by:
- Ms. Afrah Ali Al-Sharfi <orig>افراح علي الشرفي</orig> – Secretary of the Board of Directors – (Secretary of the Meeting).
- Shareholders holding 139,337,419 shares (in person and by proxy), representing 99.998% of the company's total paid-up capital shares, which amount to 139,347,000 shares.
After the legal quorum for the validity of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting was announced, Mr. Anwar Talal Al-Fadhli <orig>أنور طلال الفضلي</orig> – Chairman of the meeting session – opened the meeting by welcoming the attendees, then proceeded to present the items on the agenda of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting for discussion, and the following was resolved:-
- Item One: Approval was granted to amend Article (13) of the Articles of Association as follows:
- Current Text:
The company shall be managed by a board of directors composed of five members, elected by the General Assembly by secret ballot. Any shareholder, whether a natural or legal person, may appoint representatives to the company's board of directors in proportion to the shares they own. The number of board members selected in this manner shall be deducted from the total number of board members to be elected. Shareholders who have representatives on the board of directors may not participate with the other shareholders in electing the remaining members of the board of directors, except to the extent that exceeds the percentage used to appoint their representatives on the board. A group of shareholders may form an alliance among themselves to appoint one or more representatives on their behalf to the board of directors in proportion to their combined ownership. These representatives shall have the same rights and obligations as the elected members, and the shareholder shall be responsible for the actions of their representatives towards the company, its creditors, and its shareholders.
Amounts due to public institutions, public authorities, and wholly state-owned companies for their representation on the company's board of directors shall be transferred to them. The Chairman of the Board of Directors must pay these amounts directly to those entities within one week from their due date. The aforementioned entities may determine the remunerations and salaries to be paid to their representatives on the company's board of directors.
Membership on the company's board of directors shall not be included within the maximum limit for the number of memberships. A person may be the chairman of the board of directors of more than one closed shareholding company. The company may also have a chief executive officer from among the members of the board of directors or from outside. The members of the board of directors shall be elected by secret ballot at the Ordinary General Assembly meeting. A member of the board of directors may dispose of their shares in the company during their membership on the board, without prejudice to the restrictions on the disposal of shares stipulated in the Companies Law No. 25 of 2012, its amendments, and its executive regulations.
- Text after amendment:
The company shall be managed by a board of directors composed of (3) members, from whom the entity or entities entitled to appoint representatives on the board of directors shall appoint them in proportion to their ownership in the company's capital, and the remaining members shall be elected by secret ballot.
In conclusion, the Chairman of the meeting extended his thanks to the attendees, and thereupon the proceedings of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting ended at 12:00 AM on the same day.

Chairman of the Board of Directors

## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
On Monday, March 24, 2025, at 11:30 AM, the shareholders of Al-Raeda Petrochemicals Company <orig>الشركة الرائدة للبتروكيماويات</orig> – a Kuwaiti Shareholding Company (Closed) – convened, presided over by Mr. Hussein Fahad Al-Fahad <orig>حسين فهد الفهد</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors, at the Industrial Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت الصناعي</orig> building – 10th floor.
In addition to the shareholders, the meeting was attended by:
- The Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> was notified of the date of the company's Ordinary General Assembly meeting, and the Ministry acknowledged receipt of the meeting date as per the extract attached to these minutes.
- The Kuwait Clearing Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية للمقاصة</orig> apologized for their absence.
After the quorum was met with the attendance of 2,500,000 shares, in person and by proxy, representing 100% of the company's 2,500,000 shares with a capital of KWD 250,000, the items on the agenda were discussed, which the Extraordinary General Assembly unanimously approved as follows:
1) The future of the company was discussed as follows:
- The capital will be increased by a cash amount of 250,000 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
- The benevolent loan (Qard Hasan) will be converted into capital at a value of 153,000 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
- Creditor balances and other credit balances amounting to 9,805.990 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> will be written off.
- The statutory reserve amounting to 2,362 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> will be used to offset part of the accumulated losses.
- The offsetting of accumulated losses amounting to 416,967 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> was discussed and proposed, which will lead to a reduction of the capital to 250,000 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> after offsetting these losses. Offsetting the accumulated losses reflects a fundamental step to correct the company's financial position and enable it to resume its operations without the burden of previous losses.
2) Approval was granted to increase the company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital from KWD 250,000 (two hundred and fifty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars) to KWD 653,000 (six hundred and fifty-three thousand Kuwaiti Dinars), an increase of KWD 403,000 (four hundred and three thousand Kuwaiti Dinars), with a share value of 100 Kuwaiti Fils, through the following:
a. A cash increase of KWD 250,000 (two hundred and fifty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars) allocated to the current shareholders registered in the company's books as of the date of the assembly meeting, and authorizing the Board of Directors to set the rules and conditions for the capital call and to dispose of fractional shares.
b. An increase through the creditors' account amounting to KWD 153,000 (one hundred and fifty-three thousand Kuwaiti Dinars), with the principal of the debt being in cash, allocated to one of the company's shareholders, the Kuwaiti Company for Industrial Projects <orig>الشركة الكويتية للمشروعات الصناعية</orig>.
3) Approval was granted to amend Article (5) of the Articles of Association and Article (6) of the Memorandum of Association to read as follows:
Text before amendment:
"The company's capital is set at KWD 250,000 (two hundred and fifty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars), divided into 2,500,000 shares (two million five hundred thousand shares), with a value of 100 Kuwaiti Fils per share, and all shares are cash shares."
Text after amendment:
"The company's authorized and issued capital is set at KWD 653,000 (six hundred and fifty-three thousand Kuwaiti Dinars), divided into 6,530,000 shares (six million five hundred and thirty thousand shares), with a value of 100 Kuwaiti Fils per share, and all shares are cash shares." "The company's paid-up capital is set at KWD 403,000 (four hundred and three thousand Kuwaiti Dinars), divided into 4,030,000 shares (four million and thirty thousand shares), with a value of 100 Kuwaiti Fils per share, and all shares are cash shares." This is subject to the approval of the regulatory authorities.
The meeting concluded at 12:30 PM on the same day it was held.
Chairman of the Board of Directors / Chairman of the Meeting

The Extraordinary General Assembly of the shareholders of Al-Qurain Automotive Trading Company <orig>شركة القرين لتجارة السيارات</orig>, a Kuwaiti Shareholding Company (Closed), held its extraordinary meeting at 10:00 AM on Wednesday, 19/2/2025, at the company's headquarters located in the Old Shuwaikh <orig>الشويخ القديم</orig> area, Third Street, Plot No. 16, opposite the Kuwait Finance House (New) showroom.
The meeting was presided over by Mr. Ahmed Abdulaziz Ali Al-Mutawa <orig>أحمد عبد العزيز علي المطوع</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors and CEO. The meeting was also attended by:

## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting for the Year 2024

Held at 2:00 p.m. on Wednesday, 12/2/2025, at the company's headquarters in Sharq – Al-Maqwa Al-Sharqi – Block 8 – KDCC Building.
On Wednesday, 13 Sha'ban 1446 Hijri, corresponding to 12 February 2025 Gregorian, the annual Extraordinary General Assembly meeting for the year 2024 was held, with the attendance of shareholders in person and by proxy, totaling 31,636,323 shares out of 38,404,081 shares, representing a percentage of 82.378%. The meeting was also attended by the Auditor, Mr. Abdulrahman Mohammed Al-Abbasi <orig>عبد الرحمن محمد العباسي</orig>, from the Middle East Auditing Office <orig>مكتب الشرق الأوسط لتدقيق الحسابات</orig>.
Mr. Khaled Faisal Al-Qatami <orig>خالد فيصل القطامي</orig> – Chairman of the Board and CEO, proceeded to discuss the items on the agenda, and the following decisions were made regarding them:
The articles listed below were discussed, and it was unanimously approved by those present to amend and change their texts in the company's Memorandum of Association and Articles of Association as follows:
Amendment of the text of Article (4) of the Articles of Association:
Current Text:
The purposes for which the company was established are:
1- Trading, exporting, importing, leasing, and renting computers, other electronic devices, their spare parts, and the equipment necessary for their operation.
2- Providing all technical services related to computers and other electronic devices and acting as consultants and managers in related businesses.
3- Maintenance of computers and other electronic devices and the establishment of maintenance workshops and spare parts warehouses for these devices.
4- Installation, manufacturing, and assembly of computers and other electronic devices under license from foreign companies and the development of related invention rights, after obtaining the necessary government licenses.
5- Acting as agents for foreign companies that deal in these devices, their spare parts, and their complementary and related equipment.
The company may have an interest in or participate in any way with entities that carry out activities similar to its own or that may assist it in achieving its objectives in Kuwait or abroad, and it may purchase or annex such entities.

First Item: Discussion of the amendment of Article (5) of the Memorandum of Association and Article (4) of the Articles of Association concerning the purposes for which the company was established.

Current Text:
The purposes for which the company was established are:
1- Owning shares in Kuwaiti or foreign shareholding companies, as well as owning shares or stakes in Kuwaiti or foreign limited liability companies, or participating in the establishment, management, and guaranteeing of these companies of both types before third parties.
2- Lending to companies in which it owns shares and guaranteeing them before third parties. In this case, the holding company's participation in the capital of the borrowing company must not be less than 20%.
3- Owning industrial property rights such as patents, commercial or industrial trademarks, industrial designs, or any other related rights, and leasing them to other companies for their use, whether inside or outside Kuwait.
4- Owning the movable and real estate properties necessary to conduct its activities within the limits permitted by law.
5- Utilizing the company's available financial surpluses by investing them in financial and real estate portfolios managed by specialized companies.
The company may conduct the aforementioned activities in the State of Kuwait and abroad, either as a principal or as an agent. The company may have an interest in or associate in any way with entities that engage in activities similar to its own or that assist it in achieving its objectives in Kuwait or abroad. It may also establish, participate in, purchase, or affiliate with such entities.

Text After Amendment:
The purposes for which the company was established are:
1) Holding company activities – Code No. (642000)
2) Managing its subsidiary companies or participating in the management of other companies in which it holds shares and providing the necessary support to them – Code No. (642010)
3) Investing its funds in trading shares, bonds, and other securities – Code No. (642020)
4) Owning the real estate and movable properties necessary to conduct its business within the limits permitted by law – Code No. (642030)

6) Owning intellectual property rights such as patents, trademarks, industrial models, franchise rights, and other intangible rights, and exploiting and leasing them to its subsidiary holding companies and others – Code No. (642050)
7) Owning shares for the company's account only – Code No. (642051)
8) Business management office for holding activities – Code No. (642070)
The company may conduct the aforementioned activities in the State of Kuwait and abroad, either as a principal or as an agent. The company may have an interest in or associate in any way with entities that engage in activities similar to its own or that assist it in achieving its objectives in Kuwait or abroad. It may also establish, participate in, purchase, or affiliate with such entities.

## Announcement
The Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig> announces Tender No. (L. A. 176/2024-2025) for the supply, installation, operation, warranty, and maintenance of security systems for the General Department of Information <orig>الإدارة العامة للمعلومات</orig> for the General Department of Security Systems <orig>الإدارة العامة للأنظمة الأمنية</orig> at the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig>.
Specialized companies/institutions in this field should visit the General Department of Financial Affairs <orig>الإدارة العامة للشئون المالية</orig> – Tenders Department <orig>إدارة المناقصات</orig> (in Ardiya Industrial Area <orig>العارضية الصناعية</orig>) to obtain the documents for this tender for a fee of (150) K.D. only one hundred and fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> (via K-Net) (non-refundable) and submit an initial guarantee of (3,500) K.D. only three thousand five hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, to be included in the financial bid for the tender. The final guarantee for the tender is 10% of the total contract value. They must bring a copy of the tender announcement from the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>كويت اليوم</orig>) or the Ministry's website, along with the following documents: –
- A valid registration receipt from the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig>.
Or
- A registration request with the Ministry, followed by the purchase of the tender documents.
The closing date (submission of bids) is Wednesday, 18/06/2025, from eight (8:00) AM until one (1:00) PM. No bids submitted before or after the specified time will be accepted. Bids must be submitted to the Tenders Opening Committee <orig>لجنة فض المظاريف</orig> – Al-Siddiq School <orig>مدرسة الصديق</orig> – First Floor.
Two mandatory preliminary meetings will be held to answer inquiries from companies participating in the tender. The first will be on Wednesday, 30/04/2025, and the second on Wednesday, 19/05/2025, at the headquarters of the General Department of Security Systems <orig>الإدارة العامة للأنظمة الأمنية</orig> at exactly 10:00 AM. Any recommendations or decisions resulting from this meeting shall be considered an integral part of the tender documents and binding on all companies, whether the tenderer attends the mandatory preliminary meeting or not.

## Minutes of the Meeting of the Births and Deaths Committee Held on 23/3/2025, Committee 10/2025

After reviewing the applications submitted to amend data in the birth and death records, it was decided to make the amendments as shown in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>). If the committee does not receive any objection within fifteen days from the date of this announcement's publication, the amendment will be made in the records, and birth or death certificates will be issued according to the following amendment:

## Minutes of the Meeting of the Births and Deaths Committee Held on 23/3/2025, Committee 10/2025

The Births and Deaths Committee, stipulated in Article 15 of Law No. 36/69 and formed by Ministerial Resolution No. 1650/2021, convened.
- Mr. / Director of the Central Registry for Births and Deaths - Chairman
- Ms. / Head of the Research and Opinion Department - Member
- Mr. / Head of the Deaths Department - Member
- Mr. / Head of the Records Department - Member
- Mr. / Legal Researcher - Member

The committee's secretarial duties were performed by Ms. / Aliaa Al-Saffar <orig>علياء الصفار</orig>.
The committee reviewed applications from No. ((128)) to No. ((142)) in the attached list, concerning the amendment of data in the birth and death records for late registration of births and deaths. After examination and verification of the completion of documents and records, the committee decides to announce the amendments and applications in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) for two consecutive issues. If the legal period (fifteen days) from the date of the last announcement passes without any objection being submitted, the amendments will be made in the registers, and birth and death certificates will be issued.

# Announcement of Real Estate Sale by Public Auction
The Clerks Department of the Court of First Instance announces the sale by public auction of the property described below on Thursday, 15/5/2025, in Hall 52 on the second floor of the Justice Palace at 9:00 AM. This is in execution of the court ruling issued in Case No. 6/2022 Sales/3.
Filed by: Aziza Haidar Hassan Al-Hamar <orig>عزيزه حيدر حسن الحمر</orig>.
Against:
1- Haitham Abbas Yaqoub Al-Erian <orig>هيثم عباس يعقوب العريان</orig>.
2- Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig>.

## First: Property Description: According to the attached description certificate.
- Property under Deed No. 6231/2017 located in the Al-Khiran <orig>الخيران</orig> area – Plot 378 <orig>قسيمة ٣٧٨</orig> – Block 7 <orig>قطعة ٧</orig> – from Plan No. M/35404 – with an area of 600 m².
* **Note:**
- There are violations on the roof (a shed) with an area of 9 m², violation report No. 12697 dated 2/5/2024.
* **Inspection:**
The property in dispute is located in the new Al-Khiran <orig>الخيران</orig> residential area, Block (7) – Street (720) – House (12), Plot (378), Automated No.: 21124504, under Deed No. 6231/2017, with an area of 600 m². The inspection was conducted in the presence and with the guidance of the defendant and Mr. Saad Al-Mutairi <orig>سعد المطيري</orig>, the expert consultant retained by the administration. The plaintiff was absent. The inspection was carried out as follows:
- The property subject of the lawsuit is a newly constructed private residence located on one street and an alleyway, consisting of three floors. The facades are finished with Sigma paint, it has central air conditioning, and an elevator.
- The ground floor consists of: a diwaniya with its bathroom, a living hall, 4 bedrooms, a kitchen, and a maid's room with its bathroom. It is a separate unit.
- The first floor consists of: a living hall, 6 bedrooms, 5 bathrooms, and a kitchen. It is not a separate unit.
- The second floor consists of two apartments (Apartment No. 1 consists of a living hall, kitchen, 3 bedrooms, and 3 bathrooms) and (Apartment No. 2 consists of a living hall, kitchen, 4 bedrooms, and 4 bathrooms). It is not a separate unit.
- The expert consultant, Mr. Saad Al-Mutairi <orig>سعد المطيري</orig>, took all his notes in preparation for appraising the value of the property.

## Second: Auction Conditions:
**First:** The auction shall start at a base price of KWD 210,600 (Two hundred ten thousand and six hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). To participate in the auction, a deposit of at least one-fifth of this price must be paid by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Department at the Ministry of Justice.
**Second:** The person whose bid is accepted by the judge must deposit the full accepted price, expenses, and registration fees during the sale session.
**Third:** If the person whose bid was accepted does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction will be reopened at their liability in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
**Fourth:** If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless another person comes forward in that session who agrees to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the auction shall be reopened in the same session on the basis of this new price.
**Fifth:** If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the auction shall be immediately reopened at their liability on the basis of the price that was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
**Sixth:** The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for title transfer and registration, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to KWD 200, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
**Seventh:** This announcement is published in accordance with the law. Those initiating the sale procedures do so at their own responsibility, and the Clerks Department of the Court of First Instance shall bear no liability.
**Eighth:** The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.
**Notice:**
1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law.
2- The auction award judgment is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law stipulates that "If the person whose property has been expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to execute a lease agreement in their favor for a comparable rent."

On 30/4/2019, we proceeded to inspect the property subject of the lawsuit, accompanied by the technical expert <orig>خبير الدراية</orig>, Mr. Salman Hamad Al-Bahouh <orig>سلمان حمد البحوه</orig>, in the presence of the second defendant in person. # Announcement of Public Auction for a Property
The Clerks' Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig> announces the public auction of the property described below, to be held on Thursday, 15/05/2025, in Hall 52, Second Floor, Palace of Justice, at 9:00 AM. This is in execution of the court ruling issued in Case No. 338/2024 Sales/3.
Filed by: Hussein Abdul Hamid Ali Abdul Hussein <orig>حسين عبد الحميد على عبد الحسين</orig>.
Against:
1- Zuhour Habib Abdulredha Al-Faraj <orig>زهور حبيب عبدالرضا الفرج</orig>.
2- Undersecretary of the Ministry of Justice for Real Estate Registration and Notarization Affairs <orig>وكيل وزارة العدل لشئون التسجيل العقاري والتوثيق</orig>, in his capacity.
3- Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig>.

## Property Description: According to the attached description certificate.
Property under Document No. 1460/2015, located in Saad Al-Abdullah City – Plot No. 648 – Block 9 – from Plan No. M/38797 – with an area of 400 m².
Note: There is a violation on the roof, an increase in the building ratio, according to the Municipality's letter.

### *Inspection:
The disputed property is located in the Saad Al-Abdullah City area – Block (9) – Street (940) – House (16) – Property PACI No. (93383839). The inspection is as follows:
The disputed property is a residential plot consisting of a ground floor, first floor, second floor, and a roof. The exterior cladding is beige Sigma paint. It is located on a corner with two facades, north and east, overlooking a street, and is bordered by neighbors on the other sides. Its area is 400 m².
The plaintiff provided guidance on the components of the disputed property as follows:
The ground floor consists of three (3) halls with external washbasins and a bathroom, a diwaniya with external washbasins and a bathroom, a kitchen, a master bedroom with its bathroom, a laundry room, a maid's room with its bathroom, and a driver's room with its bathroom.
The first floor: consists of five (5) master bedrooms with their bathrooms, a kitchenette, a hall, and a balcony.
The second floor: consists of two apartments. The first apartment consists of two (2) rooms, a master bedroom with its bathroom, a kitchen, a hall, a bathroom, and a maid's room with its bathroom. The second apartment consists of two (2) master bedrooms with their bathrooms, a hall, a bathroom, a kitchen, and a maid's room with its bathroom.
The roof consists of a room with its bathroom, a kitchen, a driver's room with its bathroom, and a boiler room. The roof does not conform to the plan of the disputed property.
Central air conditioning.
There is an elevator in the disputed property.
The property's flooring is ceramic.
There are two (2) external entrances to the property: a main entrance and a side entrance.
The disputed property is fully leased and generates income.
The appointed expert inspected the property in question in preparation for assessing its value according to prevailing market prices and preparing his report.

## Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall start at a base price of KWD 380,000 (three hundred and eighty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of this price by a certified check from the drawee bank or a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Department at the Ministry of Justice.
Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees during the sale session.
Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction will be reopened at their liability in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session who agrees to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the auction will be reopened in the same session on the basis of this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the auction will be immediately reopened at their liability based on the price at which it was previously awarded to them. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for the transfer and registration of ownership, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to KWD 200, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law and at the request and responsibility of those initiating the sale procedures, without the Clerks' Department of the Court of First Instance bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.

### Notice:
1- This sale announcement is published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law.
2- The auction award ruling is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law states that "If the person whose property has been expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder is obligated to draft a lease contract in their favor for a similar rent."

**President of the Court of First Instance**

This is in execution of the court judgment issued in Case No. 2022/684 Sales/3.

**Filed by:**
Abdullah Bashir Anbar Salman <orig>عبدالله بشير عنبر سلمان</orig>, on his own behalf and as an agent for:

**Against:** Maryam Farhan Sulaiman Bughaith <orig>مريم فرحان سليمان بوغيث</orig>.

**First: Property Description:** As per the attached description certificate.
Property under Document No. 1993/7227, located in the Salwa <orig>سلوى</orig> area - Block No. 2 - Plot 77 - Plan M/27449 - with an area of 823 m².
Note: There is a violation, which is the construction of an elevator without a license and without a plan (according to the Municipality's letter).

**Inspection:**
In the session of 7/2/2022, we proceeded to the disputed property located in the Salwa <orig>سلوى</orig> area - Block (2) - Street (3) - Building (19) - Plot (77) - Automated Address Number (11834473), to inspect the property on-site in preparation for its valuation. This was done in the presence of Mr. Abdullah Bashir Anbar Salman <orig>عبد الله بشير عنبر سلمان</orig> (the plaintiff, in person) and as an agent for the first through sixth plaintiffs, and Ms. Maryam Farhan Sulaiman Bughaith <orig>مريم فرحان سليمان بوغيث</orig> (the defendant, in person), and with the assistance of Mr. Technical Expert / Khalid Al-Khodair <orig>خالد الخضير</orig> from the Technical Expertise Section of the General Directorate of Experts. The inspection was carried out as follows:
The disputed property conforms in its general and specific specifications to Document No. (1993/7227) with an area of (832 m²). The disputed property overlooks one street and is bordered by neighbors on three sides. It is jointly owned and divided into two parts, each with an area of (416 m²). They share a single boundary wall but differ in design, with a barrier between them. At the front facade, there is a setback of approximately 2.5 m.
- The disputed property consists of two parts, detailed as follows:

**1- Specifications of the First Part of the Disputed Property (B19):**
- It consists of two and a half floors. The construction condition of the first part (B19) is good and recently renovated.
- The ground floor consists of a diwaniya with its bathroom and washbasins + a driver's room with its bathroom + 3 living rooms + a bedroom + a large kitchen + a bathroom + a yard for the car entrance.
- The first floor consists of 3 master bedrooms + 2 bedrooms + a bathroom + a small living room.
- The roof consists of: a maid's room + a laundry room + a bathroom + a storage room.
- Air conditioning in the first part: Split units.
- There is an elevator in the first part. The floors are ceramic and the walls are painted. There is one internal staircase and 2 external iron staircases leading to the roof.
- The external cladding of the first part: Beige-colored Sigma.
- There are two entrances to the first part, and all windows have shutters.

**2- Specifications of the Second Part of the Disputed Property (19): It consists of two and a quarter floors, and the house is in old condition.**
- The ground floor consists of: a yard and a car garage + 2 living rooms + a family room + a dining room + a kitchenette + 2 bathrooms + a small storage room + a maid's room + a main kitchen (in the yard).
- The first floor consists of: a living room + a master bedroom with a dressing room + 2 bedrooms + a bathroom + a kitchenette.
- The roof consists of: a laundry room + a bathroom. There are two entrances.
- Staircases: One internal staircase serving the first floor and the roof.
- Flooring: Sicilia marble and parquet on the first floor.
- Walls: Painted.
- Air conditioning: Central.
- Elevators: None.
- Exterior finishes: Pink Jordanian stone, with the facade inlaid with brown ceramic tiles.
- The technical expert inspected the property in preparation for estimating the value of the disputed property and submitting the relevant report for its sale at public auction.

**Second: Auction Conditions:**
First: The auction shall start at a base price of KWD 765,000 (Seven hundred sixty-five thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). To participate in the auction, a deposit of at least one-fifth of this price must be paid by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Department at the Ministry of Justice.
Second: The person whose bid is accepted by the judge must deposit, during the sale session, the full accepted price, plus expenses and registration fees.
Third: If the person whose bid was accepted does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their liability in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session who agrees to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding will be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding will be immediately reopened at their liability, based on the price that was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.

Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction will start at a base price of 300,000 K.D. (three hundred thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). To participate in the auction, a deposit of at least one-fifth of this price is required, payable by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Directorate <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The person whose bid is accepted by the judge must deposit the full accepted price, expenses, and registration fees during the sale session.
Third: If the person whose bid was accepted does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction will be reopened at their liability in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session who agrees to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the auction will be reopened in the same session on the basis of this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with the ten percent increase, the auction will be immediately reopened at their liability based on the price that was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder will be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for the transfer and registration of ownership, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D., legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.

Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges having inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.
